reviews.review_msg: Dave is a super nice prof, and he's always available when you have questions for him. His teaching can sometimes be confusing but if you ask him to explain it to you again you will probably understand it.

Boring and dry as could be. Confuses you beyond beleif with the use of SPSS. You have an "extra help lab" in order to learn how to use this $2000 useless computer program, but naturally none of the TA's in the lab know what SPSS is. Exams are hard and assignments are even harder to understand.
He is a great teacher, except when he tries to explain voluntary samples - then he makes no sense at all.

disorganized, does not explain very well. powerpoint are useless and exams are just all over the place. I am extremely nervous about the final, did well on the first MT, second MT 50% (after he curved it). many errors from his marker, you will receive less mark if you don't look over your work and talk to him.

he tries to explain but too bad he doesn't have the talent to explain well.. when he says that the final is related to the assignment questions and has nothing to do with definitions don't believe him.. >.> you should know your definitions to at least pass this course!

he can't explain... doesn't relate materials to textbook... crappy book, crappy lecture... wording on exams are different from his lectures and the book.  Extremely easy first midterm cuz the material is basically grade 8 math... our class avg for 2nd midterm was 47%... so i'm thinking it's not really my problem...

Doesn't know how to teach. Smart guy and knows his stuff but dreadfully boring and not good at making stuff clear. Stopped going after the first midterm and my grade went up just relying on the textbook and its practice problems. Does post all his notes which is nice.
Please don't do this to yourself Take literally any other prof's class

One of this prof's talent is to confuse you about what you already knew. He almost never finish a clear & logical sentence. His explanation of a concept is vague and disorganized. The notes on the course are really useless to understand the materials unless you read the text. To sum, he is a nice guy with terrible teaching skills.
He was super easy! I didn't like Stats but taking it with him went very well. Must take!
He cares about his students. Willing to go the extra mile.
Ian is just an amazing prof.

I don't get profs who don't use Canvas. What an annoyance. He had a rough semester and yet he managed to keep on coming to class and teach so good on him. Material is easy. Just read the textbook and do the assignments. This prof wants you to do well

Like everything about this prof and the class, except the grading structure of his exams.  All questions are given the same weight - definitions and questions requiring lengthy calculations are worth same marks.  Overall, he is more than fair and understanding and would highly recommend.

I am a third year student and he is the best professor I have had so far. He genuninely wants his students to do well and is always available for extra help - if you take advantage of that your mark will definitely reflect it. Attend class and apply yourself on assignments and a good mark on tests will come easily. Only complaint is messy writing.

Great prof that genuinely wants students to do well, highly recommended. Be prepared to put in effort though as there are 5 assignments due every other week and 2 midterms. Overall, very kind and fair. Only complain is that he needs to work on his messy writing, and stop giving lectures after midterms, no one wants to do more math after a midterm.

The best! Amazing teacher, he really wants his students to do well. He is always available for extra help if you need it. I was worried going into this class, being my first stats class, but it has been one of my favourites! Best teacher I've had. Hopefully I get to take an other class with him one day.

The best! So helpful and always available for extra help if you need it. You can tell he really wants his students to do well and he keeps class interesting. I was worried going into the class, being my first stats class, but I am so happy with it. I recommend this prof highly and I really hope I get to take an other one of his classes.
Ian is an awesome guy who you can tell loves teaching and wants to help you. That being said, don't take this course if you struggle with M/C.
AMAZING PROF!!always willing for extra help&super nice...
Ian Bercovitz is an excellent prof. who take great interest in helping his students. I began to appreciate statistics with him. Very kind, helpful and I wish more professors like him.
Extremely helpful. Good notes. Made statistics fun.
Entertaining and helpful.

Midterms were both fair - because you're allowed a cheat sheet Final exam was a bit harder than midterms but overall fair - because you're allowed a cheat sheet Assignments were super long with some tricky questions Funny sense of humour, never went to lectures even though they probably would've helped
Best stats prof! Exams are just like his practice, only have to read notes and the class is an easy A

Although the content may seem overwhelming with formulas and few calculations, he tries to make the fun out of it with memes and examples. midterms were straight forward and his flowcharts help a lot with studying

He's a little bit disorganized. Sometimes (okay a lot of the times) he messes up the numbering of questions and forgets things but he always acknowledges it and laughs at himself. I really enjoyed him as a prof. Actually really cares about students understanding and take the extra time to help the class understand something.

Jack is the best prof I've ever had!  He is very knowledgeable and nice .  His midterms and final are easy as long as you go through all of his notes and assignments.  Definitely go to his office hours cuz he is very, very helpful on any questions regards to assignments or notes.  Nice and funny prof!  Definitely choose his class! :)

Jack is the most helpful professor I have ever encountered. He is extremely dedicated to helping his students. He is extremely nice and understanding and does his best to make the material interesting. The class material is difficult but he does everything possible to help you succeed. He has a good sense of humor and is kinda cute as well :)

Jack is nice, funny, and sympathetic to his students. But he's really, really disorganized. It was always a pleasant surprise when a question made sense the first time around. I recommend taking his courses after he's had a few more years experience.

One of the best professors teaching STATS coming from a crim major. Her lectures are kind of run on and you might think skipping lecture is okay but I actually learnt a lot from her, I think She explains concepts very well compared to other profs. The other reviews seem bad butassignments gave direct instructions and were not difficult to complete.

Girl why am I spending 3 hours on the weekly homework just for it to be worth 1% each ??? Marie is a very nice person but her lectures are unorganized. Make sure to put R question examples on your cheat sheet because she puts it on the exam. If R was a person I would brutally murder it. Still don't know what a confidence interval is.

This is a stats course for those who are in the social sciences, and likely don't have a ton of math experience. It was an absolute nightmare. The homework is insane and takes hours to complete. Her exams are horrible and defeating. I tried my level best and still barely passed. Avoid at all costs

One of the messiest profs i have had so far, not easy to follow and expects a lot from her students when half the time her slides are incorrect and full of errors. Midterm av was 52%, instead of going over the concepts she said how disappointed she was in us. Avoid her at all costs, weekly 3hr assignments with coding you must teach urself worth 10%

she's nice but can't teach and her lectures are confusing. she says something and then corrects herself a few slides later or she'll have an example on the slide but then it says "check my work" or something... like miss girl YOU check it! there's too many platforms that are used like clicker, achieve, canvas, stat workshop and crowd mark.

Do not take this course with her!! It's an overall heavy class with many concepts and things to learn. She's actually very sweet and seems to care about her students but she does not know how to teach and convey information. She is a tough grader and gives out so many assignments that are excessively long. She cannot teach!

Her class is very hard because it is statistics that is meant to be for people in social sciences. Less than half the class would be at lectures and therefore most people failed the midterm. If you take her class you need to attend the lectures every week to understand what is going on. The start of the class is pretty easy but it gets much harder

Please avoid this prof at all costs!!! Extremely unclear and has no idea what she is doing 95% of the time. Gives so much homework for it to be worth only 10% in total. Her midterm average was absolutely horrible and then wonders why as if she is not the issue. She is generally nice but a terrible prof. Please avoid for your own sanity.

Marie was very nice and it was obvious that she had good intentions. I didn't find her lectures helpful and instead relied mostly on the textbook (which was very useful). Assignments were very similar to how she formatted her exams, but were time consuming and only worth 12%. Wouldn't recommend unless you want to teach yourself the material.

Marie is super sweet however her teaching was crazy. She will speed run through lectures and teach the wrong materials and then will try and correct herself later. You will have homework to do all the time but each assignment is only worth 2% of your grade. She is a nice person but would avoid taking a class with her!

This professor is a nice person but was very disorganized this term. She would constantly make mistakes in lecture and then send 7 emails correcting herself. The assignments are too long, redundant, and the marking is inconsistent. The tests are worth too much and the only good thing she did was yelling off on people who were talking. Slay

she is a very kind person but a very disorganized prof. it is very difficult to learn in her class because she will teach you a concept incorrectly and then double back and reteach it. the assignments are worth about 2% of your grade but are very long. not impossible to succeed in this class but very difficult.

I am not one to leave negative reviews ever but, this prof really deserves it.This class had the potential to be enjoyable and interesting but, she makes it dreadful. The lack of explanation in her lectures and slides and her monotone voice makes it very difficult to attend class. Anyways, AVOID THIS PROF IF YOU HAVE ANY RESPECT FOR YOURSELF!!!!!!

Though we aren't marked for attendance, it would be tough if you missed class. Her slides occasionally have blank examples that she fills in during lecture that helped me later with practicing concepts. Assignments were ridiculously long for being only worth 12% total of our entire grade, with a 5% per HOUR late mark deduction.

The absolute worst professor at SFU by far. has no idea what shes teaching and often sends 15 emails a week correcting things she's said during lecture or on assignments. DO NOT TAKE ANY CLASS WITH HER

She often accidentally teaches the wrong answer for the wrong question and then corrects her self after realizing she taught us something else. Coding is barely covered in class and is heavily based on our homework assignments. She also accidentally gives us the wrong coding then, corrects herself later. If this wasn't a requirement, don't take.

If you need to take this course, take it with Darby. From what I've heard, he's much better at teaching it than most of the other instructors. I'm not a stats student, and I found the material very accessible the way he explained it. Open book exams were nice. Down-to-Earth, approachable guy, and good sense of humour.

do not listen to all the girls on here who say he is easy because they think he is cute! 203 is a difficult coarse and he doesnt help very much .. he will send out info the night before the exam and often has mistakes in his own work! avoid !!!

Material is dull, but he kept the pace up and had lots of examples ... was pretty easy on the eyes. Assignments and exams were not easy, but were fair. Was open to correcting marking errors (thanks!). Would definitely take more classes from Darby!

I took Derek Bingham's class quite a few semesters again for stat 203. I am not a math person by any means, and had not taken a math course in four years. After I failed the first midterm he and I would meet after class (even without office hours) and he would coach me through the course material. Hands down the best, most caring prof I've met.
Great prof who gives incredibly clear lectures. Do the work and you'll get an A easily.

Best Stats prof at SFU. He is funny and not intimidating at all, don't be afraid of asking him 'dumb' questions. Makes everything clear by repeating important points in lecture. If you get lower than a B, you know you're not even trying. This is the easiest course at SFU. Textbook is helpful and there will be questions from there as homework.

I didn't do well in this class because I was really lazy. However, he seems like he is the best professor to take stats with. His exam questions come straight from the assignments and practice problems. (maybe I should have done them) make sure to attend lecture because he leaves some slides blank and you have to fill them in yourself
Amazing prof -- exams are based on course content (no surprises!). He genuinely cares about his students and wants them to excel. If you want to do well in stats, take them with this professor.
He is such a great professor. The way he teaching is very clear but a little bit slow sometimes. First Midterm was a little bit hard.. Anyways, great teacher, easy course, please take his class!!
Pretty easy course for those who like mathematics/plugging in numbers. Studied an hour for final and got an A. That said, basic algebra should be easy.
Great teacher! he made math not boring. Super easy to understand and he goes over everything slowly. There is a lot of assignments, but easy. he has a good voice (like should be on commercials)

Before I took a class with her, I read the comments about her and I was really scared!!! But if you do the assignments and read the material that she have assigned, you would be fine in her exams. She might seems serious, but I think that she is a kind person and care about her students a lot.

All I have to say is, Gaitri just shouldn't be teaching... she doesn't like her students and her students don't like her. She has little to no patience for people who are not good with math, she thinks she is the best prof to exist when sadly.. it is the opposite. She was also rude and embarrassed students. Avoid

Honestly she's not even as bad as what some people say. Her classes aren't terrible theres a reason she can be a prof. Yes, she is confusing during lectures but the concepts are pretty straightfoward. As long as you pay attention to the syllabus and quiz/exam schedule you'll be fine. The textbook helps because it provides more in depth information

Worst prof I've had by FAR. Super disorganized and overall incredibly rude. We stopped asking questions during lectures because she would treat us like idiots if we asked anything. Spent way too much time waiting for us to quiet down even after we stopped talking. A few students dropped the class because of her, I should've done the same!

Worst prof Ive ever had. She was consistently rude and very unapproachable. Her lectures left me feeling more confused and I had to teach myself the class with the textbook. She is also extremely disorganized with her canvas page and consistently forgot to tell us important information regarding grading and format changes due to COVID-19.

The WORST prof I have ever had. Absolutely avoid at all costs- or buckle up for the worst semester of your life. Gaitri is extremely disorganized and her course content is unclear 99% of the time. Avoid avoid avoid!!!

After talking to friends who have taken Stats at a different university or with a different teacher, the clear lack of care for students or the ability to teach is super apparent. To pass this class you basically need to teach the entire thing to yourself from the textbook or from UBC or any other lectures on youtube. After COVID-19 it got worse

Avoid this prof at all costs. Straight up? She sucks. Disrespectful to her students, doesnt seem to care how anyone does on their grades, and an absolute narcissist. Go back to the hole you crawled out of :)

the worst professor Ive had at SFU. I found stat 203s content to be easy, but her lectures (incredibly disorganized and meaningless) make the course harder and more confusing. Test questions make no sense, they read like they have been sent through google translate 15 times. Just terrible

EXTREMELY unclear, disorganized, short with students, avoids questions, easily flustered and makes it obvious that she is not there to help students learn. Worksheets and iclickers could be helpful except she never gives answers to anything. I left the mandatory lectures more confused than after reading the chapter myself beforehand. Horrid teacher
i-Cliker made my life better then it ever was. Best name representation you can possibly hear in your life. If you survived 1st midterm be sure, nothing can destroy you.

AVOID. AT. ALL. COSTS. The absolute WORST professor at SFU, I am surprised she is even allowed to teach anymore because she is the most disorganized and unclear individual I have ever encountered, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER unless you want to be confused at every aspect of her online HW which she NEVER explains, extremely inaccessible as well!

Would not recommend Gaitri. Not a single lecture all term, only useless clicker questions. Does not answer questions, never available for help. Exams are nothing like the textbook material. The syllabus was not helpful. unorganized individual. Very rude to students. She has a phd in stats yet says "you guys know better" do we though? DO NOT TAKE!

Worst prof at sfu. If you want to fail and feel like you have a -1 IQ feel free to take her class. Assignments, quizzes and Exams all do not make any sense at all. She is disorganized, doesn't answer emails or questions in class. Iclicker questions are also useless. DO NOT TAKE HER!

She teaches in an inverse lecture style so do the chapter reading ahead of time or you'll have no idea what's going on when you come to class. class is more for practice problems. also go to TA hours!!! it made all the difference. the prof is a little disorganized but the kindest person ever, actually enjoyed stats which didn't think was possible.

This course is much better than I anticipated. Gaitri is a good prof. The assignments and exams are okay. Just follow the examples in the notes and textbooks and you will do fine. Sure Gaitri might not be very clear sometimes she is friendly and helpful. The TAs in the workshop are also helpful should you need extra help. Study and you can do fine.

For everyone that is complaining. You all want an easy A. Sure she doesn't answer questions clearly sometimes, so you should go to the STAT workshop then. Dont blame her for your bad grades. Overall, she was pretty good, and she clearly outlines what she expected for exams. To do well..go to class, read, and do problems at back of text chapters.
If I had the power to fire profs...

This Prof doesnt explain ANYTHING and had to rely on lab tutors to explain ALL the material!!! Very short with students and hates answering their questions. Its like taking distance ed basically!!! AVOID this Prof and take this class with someone else who actually puts a half effort into teaching (she is so bad, basically anyone else is a better choice) GPA Killer + major headaches every day = statistics 203 with Dr. Yapas!

She seemed to be a nice person and she is really into stats, but the course was all over the place. She gives formulas and doesn't say what they are for, it became so confusing that I just said 'screw it' and took notes without really understanding. The assignments are easy if you follow the examples in the book. THE BOOK! It saved my grade.

Surprisingly comprehensible, the course is just difficult. However, you MUST read the material before lecture and be prepared to use the text as a GUIDE, rather than as the only resource. Test q's and book q's are not well co-ordinated/related, but she warns you of this ahead of time (if you attend lectures). A little bit erratic with office hours.

Horrible. Doesn't care if students understand the concept or not as long as she is done covering the notes for that particular lecture. Explanations are extremely convoluted and notes are very unorganized. Answers questions very vaguely and doesn't clarify. Tests q's are nothing like study q's in book. Stop hiring people of this calibre SFU.

She's not as hard as everyone thinks; however, she may not be as fluent as people thought in speaking English but it wasn't difficult to understand what she said most of the time. If you frequently ask questions upon questions that you find difficult to understand throughout the course, she'll be willing to help you.

AVOID THIS CLASS! The only reason anyone passed is because exams are open book, but that is only helpful to a limited extent, since Gaitri deviates in crazy, nonsensical ways from the explanations in the textbook. Such a terrible teacher, extremely unhelpful and unclear. I would never take a class with her again.

-midterm and homework heavy
-strong non-understandable accent
-doesnt know how to explain content which made learning hard no one came to class due to this
-class was very hard thought i was doing good before the final
-final worth 45% (class average 38%) didnt curve it filled with content never taught, grammar errors and lots of incoherences

Overall, the class was pretty difficult. Joan's lectures did not particularly help, unfortunately due to her strong accent and the overwhelming amount of material. With around 25+ chapters cramming is not option. However, thanks the curve and pop quizzes throughout the semester I survived.

I thought I was smart before taking this class. Joan is such a sweet lady but by the end of the term I was convinced she was manipulating me. Her final was a psychological game, nothing like any of the homework or even the midterm. If you take this class I would also recommend you start praying to a god.

I am not kidding when I say professors who cannot speak a lick of English should teach heavy courses like this. The final exam (worth 45% of the grade) was filled with content never taught, grammatical errors, and countless incoherences which made the class so much harder. I had no idea what was being asked of me in any of the exams.
During her class, you will certainly feel that she is inexperienced and her lecture notes are not clear and she has no confidence.

I did really well in her class. I am so glad I got her as my prof. She is new at teaching but I see that as an advantage because she made things pretty simple and easy. The concepts are challenging but I found her notes to be helpful. We did lots of practice and the assignments were marked very fairly. Visit her office hours, super helpful!

Oksana is a new professor, & this was made very obvious from the beginning. She is very sweet and wants her students to do well. I think her teaching will improve over time as she gains more experience. I often got confused in lecture, but textbook was VERY helpful & clear. She does tend to make a lot of typos-even on review questions for final :(
Inexperienced prof who knows the concepts but doesn't know how to teach them. Her notes were quite confusing and she makes the concepts quite confusing when they aren't.

Prof is new at teaching and it's obvious: little class presence or control, lacks confidence and clarity. Very nice and wants us to excel but spends too long on concepts yet doesn't explain them clearly. 2 students in class keep asking irrelevant questions and nitpicking at everything she does - it makes her more nervous and class more confusing.

Gamage's STAT 203 class is engaging and well-structured. He explains complex concepts clearly with practical examples, making statistics fun. Lectures are engaging and assignments reinforce learning effectively. His supportive style fosters success, though the final exam is heavy, so consistent studying is really essential.

STATS 270 was not an option but Harsha is the best prof I've had so far. He's very respectful and kind and is always wanting feedback from his students. His exams are very fair and realistic as well. Would recommend 10/10 and to go to his office hours even if you don't have any questions.

I had held back on taking STAT203 for years and finally took it with Harsha. He made it feel easier and took his time explaining concepts. The assignments really helped prepare for tests and he even allowed cheat sheets which really helped. Would definitely recommend taking his class, especially for statistics!

Harsha is such a king, he's an amazing professor who made stat 203 a very doable and enjoyable class. He's super caring and will make sure everyone understands the concepts. I love how he would emphasize and repeat important concepts in the course. If you do the assignments and keep up with the lectures and course, you can do really well!
He was missing for a bunch of classes and didn't give the sub any material to teach.... also he scaled me down so it messed up my mark so bad.... was a big disappointment

Dr. Perera is a really good prof compared to the other statistics profs. His midterms are straight forward (except a few tricky questions) and his lectures are easy to follow. My only complaint about him is that he wasn't in class for like 6 classes out of the semester and his replacement couldn't teach properly - making catching up harder.

Very helpful during office hours. Goes over everything needed to do well on midterms and final in his lectures just pay attention to his "hints" and examples. Tells you exactly what you need to know and understand to do well in the course. Amazing Prof!

Took my first stats course with Harsha and while intimidated at first, I was pleasantly surprised by the outcome. He is clear about his expectations and truly wants you to learn in his course. He is also very helpful and understanding as others have said as well.  Thank you for a great semester Harsha and keep up the excellent job!

Great prof! Let's you have a cheat sheet for the exams, which aren't that difficult in the first place. What helped me was taking notes while he goes through ppt slide. Lectures are important because he drops a lot of hints there. As mentioned below, he should probably have more examples in lecture. Be sure to go through the textbook questions!

very understanding as he just finished his PH.D recently and knows how it feels to be in our seats. Gives hints for what will be on the exam and a breakdown for the questions by topic. Final exam was more difficult than the midterms but still fair. Get to use cheat sheets for exams. It was my first stats class and he made it easier than I expected

Harsha provides helpful lecture slides, but you have to take the time to go over them on your own. He didn't provide any example questions which would have been useful when studying for the midterms and the final. Go to lecture and pay close attention, go home and review notes again before exams.

I didnt enjoy this class at all I had to take it. Read the textbook because it explains everything more clearly than he does. He sends out lecture notes so you don't really need to attend class. He is extremely confusing and jumps around on a topic. If you ask a question he just rereads the lecture notes. Tests are fine + assignments, usage of SPSS

tip is to spend time reading the textbook. video not help much. Written midterm, pretty much the core basic of the whole course. The final was multiple choices, understand all the concepts, kind of basic math but you need to know when to use which formula. SPSS only need simple steps,try to have as much in4 in the graph as possible.TA not useful

Took this class online - it was a struggle. Short, unhelpful lecture videos and not much support from the professor or TAs. Unstuckstudy and the textbook were lifesavers for studying, but the exams were brutal. Not recommended.

I have a midterm with this guy tomorrow. He never told us what is on the exam (I just have to guess which chapters it is on), a 6 minute video per chapter, which is a glorified fit check with different jerseys and doesn't even have the courtesy of even giving us a practice test for what our midterm questions are going to be like. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

No lecture materials aside from very short (under 6 mins) videos, self-study from the required textbook.  Assignments are from the book but no feedback given.  Got a 0 on a question?  Go read the book again...

Horrific professor, took online but not accessible at all + TA is useless (no email provided to contact). Lectures are 6 mins and 1/2 of the time was him talking about his outfit?? Wrote the textbook so believes it will be enough, but extremely difficult to understand w/o support. Exams are difficult + lots of assignments. Don't waste your time.

Professor provided very little resources and help apart from posting short video clips skimming over textbook material. TAs were slow to respond and the entire course was essentially self-taught. There is a penalty scheme for the multiple choice final exam. I would recommend taking this course with another professor and in-person.

I'm pretty sure this guy just records his videos, posts them for his online class, and then just hides somewhere and let's the TA do the heavy lifting. Don't ever take this class. Only saving grace is the P/C/NC means I won't tank my GPA, though I'll never get my money back and I certainly won't take a class with him ever again.

Terrible professor, don't take this course with him. He will not help you, did not even come to midterms, and we couldn't even clarify questions with anyone because of the TA strike, and random volunteers were helping out with the midterm with no professor. He expects you to learn alone with no external help.
Worst prof ever. He has terrible lecture videos, doesn't even go over anything, and our exams are nonsense. He doesn't even have office hours. Don't take the class with him.

I've noticed the course materials and readings provided are somewhat limited. Having more diverse and comprehensive sources would greatly enrich our understanding of the subject matter. I felt certain concepts were not adequately explained in lectures. Providing more detailed explanation would greatly help. This course is frustrating.

Worst professor I have ever had. Online provides 6 min videos per chapter, no practice exams, or power points, or examples. Doesn't teach anything, had to teach myself and get a tutor. Exams are extremely difficult and contain material that was never taught. Has penalty scheme that deducts points for wrong answers, making it impossible to pass.

Just know that for his online class, the lecture videos are of no help and the exams are completely different from the practice questions in the textbook. You are basically teaching yourself so don't expect any help from the prof or TAs bc they do not care! On top of that, he barely gives time for the exams so many students did not even finish it.

Worst professor ever, please avoid at all costs if possible. TAs don't care for your learning, you basically have to teach the whole course to yourself, and the textbook is useless. Exams are weighted so heavily, and he adds a penalty scheme on top of it all (deduction for the incorrect answer). One of the toughest profs ever.
avoid at all costs. final is in less that a week. the grade distribution is still unclear. the TA doesn't know what's going on

Arbitrary standards and shows little care about student's success. Grading scheme and course structures are changed all the time. He often refers to students by their student number or race + gender which is very weird and degrading. Very ineffective teaching - never ever does formative assessments and just yaps for 4 hours non-stop.
Not organize. Instruction is unclear. Quizzes are too difficulties. Tutorial videos are too old and not helpful.

I actually think Scott's course is not that bad, considering most students found it very hard. He's passionate and funny. However, it is statistics, and almost every stats courses I took are boring and test heavy, but I found his stats 203 is actually one of least boring stats course. (Considering I studied at both SFU and UBC)

Honestly, it was actually a pretty easy course, I got an A but I didn't listen to the class at all because I watched all the videos carefully. There was nothing on the final exam that the professor didn't cover, except that the professor was harsh and his questions were very challenging and very much tested your basics and your IQ.

Ok first things first, you can hardly understand anything in class. But, to be fair, the final exam is 60% of the course so if you study only for the final, you can still pass the course. All in all, i'd give him a 2/5.

Pai is very knowledgeable, but couldn't express it in a way anyone would be able to understand. He has a rather intolerable personality, often being extremely disrespectful to students and even to his own TA. If you don't attend his lectures which I didn't, you are basically better off learning the course by yourself. Try to avoid him if you can.

Don't get me wrong. He did try to help students but he fails to organize the material. Like there are even many mistakes in his YT videos and you need to fix them for him while you are watching them. Especially when the semester goes forward and materials became more intense, you really have to teach yourself because he just spread everything out
Avoid at all costs. The man as a teacher is as useful as a used toilet paper and as reachable as the core of a nuclear power plant.

Triggered panic attacks by yelling at students over zoom; highly unprofessional + bad learning environment. Highly disorganized and often says things that are untrue. Ex: said the lectures and youtube videos cover the same material, this is false, you need to attend lectures AND watch YT videos in order to get all material, NEVER TAKE.

i wish i listened to these reviews and did not take this class however i needed the credit. Scott is nice and smart but he makes this course extremely difficult, disorganized, and confusing. if possible definitely take it with someone else... its a lot of material to keep up with and i feel like a different approach to teaching it would be better

I did not last a week in this class. Scott is VERY disorganized. His lectures are a waste of time since all he does is repeat exactly what he said in his youtube lectures, but make it more confusing and harder to understand. His poor teaching habits caused me to drop the class mid lecture. Do not take this class.

Three hours a week of disorganized lecture with an additional one to two hours of lecture videos to watch on YouTube. Most of his YouTube videos are 3-7 years old, difficult to follow, and frequently had errors. I felt like tests did not accurately assess ability and grading was sometimes unclear. This class took years off my life :(

Honestly, I don't see the point of Scott being an uni teacher. If all he does is read out from note and posting youtube video, why I am paying for this course? what kinds of uni prof says " let me see you ugly face" to 200+student? and most of his test are about the video. The most disorganized teachers I've ever had in my uni life.

Worst professor ever at SFU. This course was a requirement and this is the only prof that teaches it. Old youtube videos that are 7 hours long are used for lectures plus live lectures 2 times a week. Never responds to emails. Exam/quiz questions always had errors and wasted our time during the exams. Avoid at all costs.

This prof is one of the worst profs I have ever had. He gives so much homework and you often have to watch 2-3 hours of lecture outside of the 3 hours of lecture you have a week. He gives you answer keys for the quizzes which helps for studying but a bunch of the answers are wrong or mixed up. He never answers his emails!!

His lectures and videos are intolerable. I relied on the textbook, other students and Chegg for explaining how to do questions. HOWEVER, marks are very generous with high class averages. The tests cover a lot of the same word questions from previous quizzes/HW, so high grades are easy to achieve if you review.
Avoid his classes at all costs. One of the worst professors at SFU. Does not do anything and expects you to teach yourself.

His class is not the way to go for an online class if you aren't into asynchronous lectures. You basically have to teach yourself and watch way too many old YouTube videos that he's posted to keep up and the videos are not the best quality and a number of errors in some videos. His live lectures are basically him going over some concepts. Not fun.

Best piece of advice you'll ever receive if your course is asynchronous: Buy a Chegg subscription. They have the answers to all his questions online. Scott answered all the questions, but watching his videos was tedious and exhausting. But, he was very generous with the grades.
basically teaching yourself the entire course and his canvas page is super unorganized. Does teach during lecture and has separate youtube videos you need to watch and calls those 'lectures'.

someone don't like him,because don't watch YouTube video and do bad in quizz. But trust me,because of his quizzes are all multiple choice s,if u really do all he told u to youu will get a good grade,in fact he is a humorous pro. this pro is fair to hardworking students
So badJust be careful if you want to choose him to be your prof. Actually, its hard to learn something from him.
i learned nothing
Never choose this course especially with him. His teaching is really bad. He would skip the topics and ask you to watch you tube video to increasing His views. His overall performance is FUDU.

It was a really really hard course and his pronunciation is terrible and he can not speak English that well but if you sit on the first row of the class he will give students better grade for their participation.

Hands down the worst prof Ive had in my life. Do what you can to not take classes with him. Hes not good at explaining concepts, makes you watch long YouTube videos of his recorded lecture and definitely isnt open to answering your questions and is usually late.
The worst professor you can come after at FIC. Horrible lectures and definitely get ready to watch his terrible youtube videos. He's a nice person but a horrible teacher.

First, he has an accent which you will get used to. 2nd, lectures are clear in early weeks but then become vague. Jumps from one topic to another without explaining the relevance. Does not explain why sth is the way it is. Comes to class late, teaches very slowly, breaks longer than what he says, AND you have to spend hours on his utube lectures.

You know there is something horribly wrong with the way he is teaching when you start to find advanced programming and math courses easier than the intro to stat course. Don't get me wrong, Scott is a really cool & funny guy. But, his lecture notes & YT videos are impossible to understand. If Scott is your only option then find good stat book&read
Try to take this course with other professors.
Hes smart and he allows you to bring a paper with notes to exams. Therere only 1 mid term and 1 final exams.
He cares about your participation in class but you just need to focus, then youll get good participation marks!!!
He likes people to send him emails to ask questions.
Go to his office hours and he will give you extra participation marks
Go to all his office hours and you will have a good grade
Good accent
Follow his advice and you will get good results. Clear explanation. Btw, he is nice and he will help you during office hours.
Clear and good English
Clear lectures
hilarious and funny

Scott is a good professor. He is hilarious and funny. Work load in the class is not heavy and he gives you time to memorise stuff during class so that you dont need to revise those taught and focus on exercises and other stuff. He gives a list of recommended exercises for you.
good guy
Greatest prof that I met
He is interesting.
He is really a nice guy.

Actually I don't know what the hell he is talking in class. Many youtube for us to watch at home, I don't know why we need to go to school. I believe that he can be a good primary teacher instead of being a professor. I strongly recommend you to choose another professor.
He's poor. Some time he's humorous, but not nice. He always late and focuses on YouTube. Why should we take class if everything we can learn online? The worst teacher that I have seen.
he will make you watch his boring youtube videos.
Poor. Sometimes hes late. And he teaches too slowly so that you need watch videos on YouTube, which wastes our time and isnt effective.
I don't want to take his courses anymore, he makes conceptions more confusing. I try to learn it the whole semester, unfortunately, I still can't really understand.
His lecture notes are mor organised and clear than the textbook. If you payed attetion during the class, you would get a good mark.

Scott had the traditional Chinese teaching style that demands absolute authority, he doesn't ask you to participate but shoving a lot of information to you instead. When you have questions he's not very willing to answer them and usually blame students because they are being "stupid". So far the worst instructor I've been experienced in Canada.

Never skip class! Lectures r organized. Don't copy notes when he is talking cuz you will get lost easily and hard to catch up again. He gives you time to copy notes after he talked. Final is challenging and you can't finish it if you don't write and think swiftly. Will pleased to take his class again for sure!  No need to buy textbook.
Don't take his course again
I like the way he taught, very clearly. Also he is a very nice person. It is useful to take this course.
he is a nice professor, though he looks like so serious.
HE IS A  GOOD TEACHER
Be care of your class participation. Keep reading online video more than two times. Reviewing class notes every week.
Not bad. Clear and professional. But The grade mostly depends on your effort , please do not blame your teacher.
i love him so much,  he is so professional he loves us, he was sick and still he tries to do his best to help us, got my nerves
Just try to avoid his courses. Seriously bad accent and grammar. Repeat the word "what" 5 times in a simple sentence.
Nice man with some funny jokes in class.

He is a funny teacher. His lecture is interesting.    His lecture is not easy and the final exam is tough! It is important to attend the classes.  If you put effort in it, you will be fine :D  One thing I want to point out is that his notes are quite messy, it will be much better if he can give us tidy notes.
Ridiculous.

Yes, this is a voluntary response. This course is not easy, but it is very helpful especially when you are going to take other STAT courses in the future. You have to be patient and watch his videos many times. At the end of the semester, when you receive your grades, you will be surprised.
Wear his red cute vest for every class, "My wife told me I'm not a handsome guy, so don't look at me when u in exams or i will deduct ur what...? I will deduct ur class PARTICIPATION! Rrr U with me?"
Scott is good. Not as bad as the bad comments.
The worst! if u are bad at math please dont take him, you are going to suffer. He sometimes give out too much information.His Final is super hard
He is really helpful
really good prof, explain everything clearly,exams are not hard,just read his notes you will be OK.
clear and nice. answer all the questions

actually, i think the professor is strict with us,however, it is really useful for us to develop a good study habit. And his notes are very helpful for review. PS: i think he want us to understand the course not just memorize, it is a really correct way to study:)))

Terribre (sic!) Chinese accent, impossible to understand him sometimes even though I know English quite well. His spelling is also awful, he makes a lot of spelling mistakes. Notes are awful and confusing, you should just read textbook and not attend his lectures if possible. Possibly the worst professor ever.

He has better vocabulary than other asians! He has clear concepts. Great Handwriting, unlike most other profs. He takes the pain to write every detail on the board. I suck in this class, but i really want to learn cus of the effort he puts in his teachings! He respects you if you respect him. A "FAIR" COIN HAS 2 SIDEs
This prof makes you work hard, he is very passionate about statistics. His humour and joke kept me coming to class, but just as in any class.
NOT BAD QUITE INTERESTING IN CLASS
very nice teacher.
No Comments

Simply fantastic, if you are taking statistics make sure you take it with Scott, he makes the subject very interesting, and you will enjoy coming to his class. Make sure you do his homework assignments

1) read the textbook before coming to class 2) always attend the lectures 3) review your notes after lecture (takes about only 15minutes)4) understand the concepts. it is not about pressing right keys on calculator. um.... you will love this class. I really now appreciate the importance of statistics in our daily lives. You will too.

Worst nightmare! I am a good student, and I've got a pretty high gpa, but he is making me go crazy! He is always late for office hours, and sometimes just skips them without telling anyone. He teaches a almost different system than the testbook but expect us to know both. Never admits that he made a mistake and blames students for it.

Terrible prof. If you want to read 600 pages and teach yourself everything, this course is perfect for you. But if you like learning from a professor (because that's why you pay for courses at a university), avoid Pulindu at all costs.
he is a nice prof! if you attend his lectures and read his lecture notes you will do well in this course. TAs are not very helpful...unless you find the right TA who knows what you are asking.

I found class confusing and prof uninvolved.  Instructions on assignments were often unclear--due dates not on syllabus but emailed out irregularly, making it hard to organize my time.  Exams were too long for time slotted.  In-class notes unclear.  Overall I found the class poorly organized with little thought given to course load. Beware.

Robin is very kind and funny. If you pay attention and work hard you will be fine. He only scales upwards, so those who do well are not penalized if the class average is low. He is great at using examples. Recommend for this class.

Great prof, he explains everything very clearly and says it over and over again! You need to pay attention in this class from the beginning and everything will start to make sense if you keep on listening even though its dry material. There is nothing wrong w/ him, he cares about his students and is a good lecturer w/ lots of enthusiasm.

Prof is pretty unengaged/unhelpful as are the TA's. Marking is extremely strict and even though the exams are open book, there will be questions that are completely out of his notes (which are not allowed for exams). Saw ppl writing in the back of their book to compensate - not really fair. Exams are far too long for time allotted.

Avoid this class if you can!! Assignments and midterm study guides did not match up with final exam. Prof did not respond to emails or keep regular office hours. TAs were absolutely useless. I was surprised that they had such a difficult time answering questions. They were of no help.

Exams were fair if you read the book and paid attention. The math skills needed were very basic. Im very bad at math (failed math 154) and was able to get grasp all the math here as long as you know how to use your calculator. I think bc first exam was so easy people just didnt study for second one and thats y marks were bad. if you work its bad
Exams are unfair because of time limit.  Teacher was not helpful and lectures were useless.Would not recommend this professor to anyone.
Class was too difficult. Final Exam was simply too long. Material covered in class was confusing. Professor did not manage to clear the confusion at all. Relied mostly on my study skills.

An average professor at best, Prof. Insley had significant difficulties communicating the most difficulties concepts and problems to us. What is P value again? What is this and that again? The whole classed was confused, and the material so boring that even a cricket match would be preferable.

Great prof, read his notes, do all the assignments, and be familiar with text book (coz it's open book exam, all 3 of them, even the final exam). He makes the most difficult concepts so easy for you to understand.
make sure to attend lectures and pay attention to his notes.

Terrible Professor. Does not care about his students. Does not give enough time on his midterms, midterms do not reflect the text, and his tests are designed so you can't pass. I hired tutor, attended all classes, stayed in stats lab, and I still received an 'f'. I dont know why he's still teaching. Condescending as well.

This class was a nightmare for those who have not had math for over 5+ years (or more) I really found that Insley is insensitive and gets frustrated when noone gets what he asks in class. Also, he is retiring, the reign of Robin is OVER!!!!!

The WORST professor in history ! I dunno y he's a prof.  He can't teach, and treats arts student like retards.  STUBBORN,ARROGANT, EXTREMELY EVIL. Luvs to torture student with assignments which you can't complete and only worth little %.  His tests are damn hard. Doesn't noe how 2 teach & LUVS TO FAIL HIS STUDENTS.  Class average was 50%.  SFU SHOU
final was unbelievably hard.

The first half of the class I slept through - thats how easy it was. Then the second half was the exact opposite. His second midterm and final exam were ridiculously long and threw some screwy questions in. His lectures sucked too.

condescending, stubborn, high-and-mighty professor. thinks all arts students are idiots ("you guys know what dice are, right?"), thinks he is always right. seriously criticised text, yet relied heavily on it & made exams open-book. assignments took about a week to complete (very hard) and were only worth 2% of overall grade each.

bad prof, sometimes he answers students questions like they were the stupidist things he heard, which is very discoraging for others to ask questions. the stuff is super easy though, thought the lec was not neccesary, the book is good eough (although he kept critizing the book, dont know why he even used this book.anyways, easy stats to take

He was so boring and seemed to always make fun of arts students.  THe class was so easy at the beginning and then got really confusing.  The second midterm was a bust, there was not enough time to finish it and he had to add 14% to everyone's midterm to be on the normal scale.  Assignments were VERY time consuming and counted for less than 2% each.

It is hard to pay attention is this course. If you are fresh off Math 12, you should have no problem with the first half of the course. However, pay attention to the 2nd half as it gets a lot trickier. Doing the exercises in the book is a must.

Hey, the guy TRIED! Insley was very kind, and he sent out notes with emails. Sure he didn't use webct and didn't know how to make emailed documents less annoying, but u sorta can't expect a guy from his generation to do a lot of techie stuff. Tests r super fair (& EASY) if u do the homework and read the book over. Assignments though, were tedious!
lousy prof
can't teach, exams are extremely difficult
Outstanding prof very good at explaining concepts

This class helped me get over my fear of quantitative courses, Professor Lin made everything so easy to understand. She broke down the logic behind the math so you have a better understanding why things happen/work the way they do, rather than just memorizing formulas or instructions. Her lectures were admittedly hard to get through, but worth it

If you need need to take stat203 as a required course, please take it with Becky! I suck at math and was scared to take this course after dropping it with swartz (terrible prof), but Becky breaks everything down and the TAs, especially Roxanne are so helpful. Be ready to study hard and consistently go to TA office hours with follow up Qs though.

She clearly cares about her students and wants them to succeed. Her content reflects on her assignments, exams and quizzes, and everything is marked fairly. It's evident she puts in the work to help her students and although the content can be tricky, she is very good at explaining everything. The course itself is tricky but she makes it easier.

Very professional and helpful, but my low rating is from how the lectures are organized/taught. There's a lot of misuse/inconsistency in notation, and information is taught in a un-abstract/generalized way. Concepts were purposely unconnected (etc. never providing general forms for Std Errors or Conf Intervals), which doesn't help future courses.

Retook this course after failing 203 with Swartz and I feel sane again!! Becky really cares about her students succeeding in her course and explains concepts clearly. She makes a lot of errors in practice/exam questions which was a little confusing to figure out, but she's the sweetest person ever so it's okay

Becky sincerely cares about her students' success. I'm not a math person but had to take the course. She taught from the ground up (re-taught what we should already know from highschool). She would dedicate a lot of her free time to re-explaining concepts or answering student questions because she doesn't want us to feel any stress over school.

If you are scared of math but you have to take STAT203, take it with Becky. The content was pretty straightforward for the first half of the semester. However, it gradually got more difficult. Becky gives you all the resources to succeed and is always quick to help. She does have an accent, so 2x lecture videos were not an option.

I loved being part of her class. She is really nice and caring for her students. She wants them to succeed.  Although she does have a small accent, you can still understand her. First half of the course was like grade 9 math. Second part of the course was like calculus.  However, if you do the practice problems  study a lot you'll do fine.

Her accent is very strong and at times it took me a while to understand what she was saying, but past that she is a good professor. Sometimes, I found that she overexplained topics, but then again you could just speed up the video. There is a textbook, but I didn't read it once and I did fine. Do the extra practice problems!
Very strong accent. Super confusing and unclear. Expects everyone to already know the course material. Course heavy in the sense that she posts multiple lectures for one week.

Great professor. Even when I would email her during weekends shed respond ASAP. Content is hard but if you put the right amount of effort youll be fine. Only thing I would wish to be better are the solutions to the practice questions, sometimes hard to understand the way she writes the solutions. Wouldve loved clearer explanations

Class was so hard but Becky is such a good prof!!!Her accent makes it difficult sometimes but she simply reads off the lecture slides and explains with examples,not hard to understand.She posts practice qs & tests, and assignments that help with future exams. Advice: put practice qs and lecture examples on cheat sheet. Good cheat sheet=pass

I improved my grade from a C- to an A- by re-taking this course with Becky. In order to do well in STATS you have to put in the work. Becky gives you ample opportunity to get bonus marks. Pre-read her lecture slides and learn all powerpoint material. Know her assignments as the questions appear for midterm and final / quizzes. She is GREAT.

Dr Lin a great prof overall, although her lectures may be confusing because of her accent she is willing to stay after lectures to fully explain concepts until you understand it. Her office hours are super accessible and she replies to emails with clear responses. The exams are made up of the homework questions and the practice exams she gives.

Homework & practice exams prepare you well for exams but her lecture slides are loaded with text and its very hard to understand her sometimes, combined it makes lectures unbearable to sit through. If you ask her to explain a concept she is very helpful + exams/assignments are fair, not a bad professor but lectures are not good/worth your time.

I have always been terrible at math, and I was very nervous about taking statistics! Becky was extremely thorough with her lessons and made the material easy to understand. She was always willing to help when I was struggling. It ended up being my favourite course of the sem, and I recommend her to anyone needing to take a Q course!

FOR STAT 201: At first I really struggled with the course but Dr. Lin provided me with extensive help and motivated me. She helped me understand the course content when I did not understand. She was very fair and provided extra opportunities to improve our marks. I highly reccomend Dr. Lin, she is knowledgeable and very kind.

AN INCREDIBLE TEACHER! The class was less memorization and more application which is what most classes should be doing. Her teaching ability is very great but her english is very awful ngl. The exams were VERY FAIR and her quizzes were easy. She emails fast. She has practice problems too which helped me the most within this course.

tons of assignments which eases the stress of needing to do well on the exams. semi-difficult material but she truly does want her students to succeed. a very fair professor and the quizzes are an easy way to make up for marks you may have missed in the homework or exams.

Becky warrants a rating because of just how incredible she is as a prof. I took Stats 201 with her and not only did she care about every one of her students and their success, but she makes stats genuinely fun to learn. The work is heavy and the assignments are frequent, but I actually came out as a solid stats user and hope to further pursue stats

Took STATS 201 with Becky and she explained concepts well and made it easy to understand with diagrams/pictures and detailed explanations. She provides practice problems for every chapter which is helpful. Also very accessible for help. She really cares about her student's success. Expect to work for your A, but definitely recommend her!

Her lectures are absolutely attrocious. She really needs to practice her english before teaching. I am a native english speaker and even I have a very hard time discerning what she's trying to say about 25% of the time and im really not kidding its that bad. If you're an ESL student I cant even imagine how much pain youll be in for her course

Good prof for stats. Clear explanations and very accessible for help. Gives practice problems for every single chapter, especially helpful for quizzes and exams. Have to put in the work for good result, but overall is great professor and definitely recommend.

If your planning on taking STATS 201/203, take it with Becky! This was my first ever STATS course and I found that Becky made it really easy to understand. She provides a lot of practice which is helpful. The final exam instruction was a bit unclear this FALL 2021 semester, but overall great professor!

For someone who does not have a math background, Becky made Stats easy to understand. I found Becky to be super responsive, passionate, and dedicated to her student's success. Yes, there is a lot of course content, quizzes, and assignments. But this was in benefit to students success. This is definitely a class you should expect to work for your A

Contrary to what other students say, I definitely recommend Becky. Her lectures were very helpful and I believe students who didn't watch struggled. She provides practice problems, which really helped with exams. Also, she teaches how to code using R, so make sure you practice using the codes provided in lectures.

STATS is a really challenging course especially for someone not coming from a math background but Becky was such a great prof. Without a doubt the best stats prof I've met at SFU. She is so caring and you can see she genuinely wants her students to love stats and succeed. The final exam is challenging but she is always accessible for more help.

While Becky cared about her students, her explanations were more confusing than just learning from the textbook. We were told that using R Jupyter (a programming language for stats) would be optional but it ended up being required for some assignments and we were never properly taught how to use it. Grades on the final averaged around 50%.

Becky made us use a program which required a minor amount of coding which I did not understand or enjoy at all. The finals were also very unorganized with us getting important info the regarding the final less then 24 hours before we took the test, ON TOP of that the average for the final was below 50%. Avoid if possible

She certainly understands statistics very well, but can sometimes be hard to understand so I had to supplement by watching videos from other profs. I found she had poor wording for some of the questions on the final which caused confusion & stress. There were last minute changes to the exam that caused undue stress. Avoid taking her if possible.

Becky is one of the best statistics instructors. Too bad she's only sessional here. She knows what she's doing and is always upfront with students. A truly dedicated teacher and wants her students to do well and enjoy learning about statistics. It's just a hard subject so people turn to hate their prof but really, she's amazing.

Great prof. Lots of people don't like her cuz she has an accent & sometimes it's hard to understand what she's saying. But she's really passionate about statistics, and she takes the time to explain until you understand, when you have questions. She's also very accessible by email & replies quickly. Very fair and kind & looks out for her students.

Dont take this class. for the love of God do not put yourself through this absolute hell. her lectures are super hard to understand, barely any time to do the exams so you have to rush, and shes just horrible and not considerate. the class avg was too high so she made the final proctored on zoom. literally the night before she made the choice.

Do not take this class. Lectures don't cover nearly anything covered by the exams and assignments. Assignments are heavily time-consuming and you learn more by watching online videos of other profs teaching the course. Very hard exams and barely any time.

exams are extremely difficult and the assignments are very time consuming. Her office hours are helpful but if you ask questions and try to understand she gets mad. Any announcements she makes or email she sends, she complains or makes excuses about the other things she has to do. Very unprofessional and rude, avoid this prof.
